title: Revelation, Number One
body:
Thar she blows! The Moxie's NEW official logo, designed and submitted by the talented Aaron Scott. Utilizing a typeface from the late 19th century (Victorian/Realist era), Aaron's logo reflects the simple, clean, fun, semi-whimsical, psuedo-retro spunk that is THE MOXIE. For his efforts, Aaron is receiving a GMail invite AND a $50 gift certificate to the website of his choice, as well as having his logo prominently featured at the top of the sidebar. I think the final decision came down to scalability, which Aaron's logo has in spades. It's as easy to visualize on the big screen as it is on letterhead, a plastic cup, or a T-Shirt.

I'd like to again thank everyone who took the time to submit a logo... without you, we wouldn't have received any submissions at all. As you can see by the title of this post, another revelation is coming down the pike. What ever could it be? The true location of Midwestburg? Dan's waist size? The true location of Dan's hat (I bet you saw that one coming a mile off)? You'll just have to wait and read!

By the way, I apologize for the extended break between this post and the last one... last week was a hectic one, to say the least. My parents had to bring my aunt to St. Louis to have an emergency valve expansion procedure performed on her heart. Fortunately, my aunt's operation went off without a hitch and she's now recouping back at home, but I had to push back my intended week of business plan revising to this week. So, as usual, I'll keep everyone posted to new updates, of which there have been a few, but more on that later.

#right {

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Ah ha! It's the little logo I put over in the sidebar. It was a few pixels too large, so IE automatically dropped the sidebar down to the bottom. It should be fixed now. Ironically, IE 6.0 parses CSS incorrectly, which is why so many designers have to utilize the box hack method to make their <div>s act correctly.
